Create a GameObject for the custom card with the AssetReference and Sprite
Reference containing the asset information Sprite to create card with The GameObject for the card
Create a GameObject for the custom card with the given asset reference. Used for loading custom card art.
Reference containing the asset information The GameObject for the custom card specified by the asset reference
Create a GameObject for the custom character with the given asset reference. Used for loading custom character art.
Reference containing the asset information The GameObject for the custom character specified by the asset reference
Create a GameObject for the custom character with the AssetReference and Sprite
Reference containing the asset information Sprite to create character with The GameObject for the character
Create a GameObject for the custom character with the AssetReference and Sprite
Reference containing the asset information Sprite to create character with GameObject containing the necessary Spine animation data The GameObject for the character
All necessary information to load an asset
Unique identifier for the asset. Set automatically by the builder.
ID used to generate the asset GUID
<<<<<<< HEAD ======= >>>>>>> aa7a5e1... Update MonsterTrainModdingAPI.csproj (#82) ======= >>>>>>> be62e5a... Load custom assets through the game's CustomAssetLoader (#84)
Create a new status effect array and add the status effect with the specified information onto the end of it.
ID of the status effect Number of stacks to apply Status effect array to append to A new status effect array one element longer than the previous one, with the status effect in the last slot
Imports localization data for a key. Sets the translation to text for all languages. If either key or text is null, the function returns harmlessly.
Key to set localization data for Text for the key in all languages
Don't set directly; use CardID instead. Unique string used to store and retrieve the card data.
Unique string used to store and retrieve the card data. Implicitly sets NameKey and OverrideDescriptionKey if null
The IDs of all card pools the card should be inserted into.
Ember cost of the card.
Determines whether the card has a normal ember cost or an X ember cost.
Name displayed on the card. Overridden by the NameKey field.
Localization key for the card's name. Overrides the Name field.
Custom description text appended to the end of the card. Overridden by the OverrideDescriptionKey field.
Localization key for the card's description. Overrides the Description field.
ID of the clan the card is a part of. Leave null for clanless. Base game clan IDs should be retrieved via helper class "MTClanIDs".
The full, absolute path to the asset. Concatenates BaseAssetPath and AssetPath.
Set automatically in the constructor. Base asset path, usually the plugin directory.
Custom asset path to load from. Must be inside the BaseAssetPath.
Loading Info for loading a card's sprite from an asset bundle.
Use an existing base game card's art by filling this in with the appropriate card's asset reference information.
Append to this list to add new card effects. The Build() method recursively builds all nested builders.
Append to this list to add new card traits. The Build() method recursively builds all nested builders.
Append to this list to add new character triggers. The Build() method recursively builds all nested builders.
Append to this list to add new card triggers. The Build() method recursively builds all nested builders.

<<<<<<< HEAD ======= >>>>>>> aa7a5e1... Update MonsterTrainModdingAPI.csproj (#82) ======= >>>>>>> be62e5a... Load custom assets through the game's CustomAssetLoader (#84)
List of pre-built card effects.
List of pre-built card traits.
List of pre-built character triggers.
List of pre-built card triggers.
These upgrades are applied to all new instances of this card by default.
Use an existing base game card's lore tooltip by adding its key to this list.
Whether or not the card has a target.
Whether or not the card targets a room.
The class associated with the card.
The type of card: Spell, Monster, Blight, Scourge, or Invalid.
The card's rarity: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Champion, Starter
Level at which the card is unlocked.
Whether or not this card is displayed in the logbook when counting all of the player's mastered cards.
A cache for the card's sprite so it doesn't have to be reloaded repeatedly.
In the event that art assets cannot be found, the game will search this for backup assets.
Builds the CardData represented by this builder's parameters recursively and registers it and its components with the appropriate managers.
The newly registered CardData
Builds the CardData represented by this builder's parameters recursively; i.e. all CardEffectBuilders in EffectBuilders will also be built.
The newly created CardData
Creates an asset reference to an existing game file. Primarily useful for reusing base game art. Cards with custom art should not use this method.
The asset's debug name (usually the path to it) The asset's GUID
Sets this card's clan to the clan whose ID is passed in
ID of the clan, most easily retrieved using the helper class "MTClanIDs"
Adds this card to the cardpool whose ID is passed in
ID of the card pool, most easily retrieved using the helper class "MTCardPoolIDs"
Don't set directly; use EffectStateType instead. Type of the effect class to instantiate.
Type of the effect class to instantiate. Implicitly sets EffectStateName.
Name of the effect class to instantiate. Either pass an assembly qualified type name or use EffectStateType instead.
Int parameter; exact purpose depends on the effect type specified in EffectStateName.
Int parameter; exact purpose depends on the effect type specified in EffectStateName.
Int parameter; exact purpose depends on the effect type specified in EffectStateName.
Int parameter; exact purpose depends on the effect type specified in EffectStateName.
Float parameter; exact purpose depends on the effect type specified in EffectStateName.
Boolean parameter; exact purpose depends on the effect type specified in EffectStateName.
String parameter; exact purpose depends on the effect type specified in EffectStateName.
Subtype parameter; exact purpose depends on the effect type specified in EffectStateName.
Builder for CharacterData parameter; exact purpose depends on the effect type specified in EffectStateName. Calling Build() will also build this parameter recursively.
RoomData parameter; exact purpose depends on the effect type specified in EffectStateName.
CharacterData parameter; exact purpose depends on the effect type specified in EffectStateName.
CardUpgradeMaskData parameter; exact purpose depends on the effect type specified in EffectStateName.
CardPool parameter; exact purpose depends on the effect type specified in EffectStateName.
CardUpgradeData parameter; exact purpose depends on the effect type specified in EffectStateName.
CharacterData parameter; exact purpose depends on the effect type specified in EffectStateName.
Vector3 parameter; exact purpose depends on the effect type specified in EffectStateName.
Trigger parameter; exact purpose depends on the effect type specified in EffectStateName.
Status effect array parameter; exact purpose depends on the effect type specified in EffectStateName.
Tooltips displayed when hovering over any game entity this effect is applied to.
Builds the CardEffectData represented by this builder's parameters recursively; all Builders represented in this class's various fields will also be built.
The newly created CardEffectData
Add a status effect to this effect's status effect array.
ID of the status effect, most easily retrieved using the helper class "MTStatusEffectIDs" Number of stacks to apply
Don't set directly; use TraitStateType instead. Type of the trait class to instantiate.
Type of the trait class to instantiate. Implicitly sets TraitStateName.
Name of the trait class to instantiate.
CardData parameter; exact purpose depends on the trait type specified in TraitStateName.
Type of card to target; exact purpose depends on the trait type specified in TraitStateName.
Team to target; exact purpose depends on the trait type specified in TraitStateName.

Int parameter; exact purpose depends on the trait type specified in TraitStateName.
String parameter; exact purpose depends on the trait type specified in TraitStateName.

Don't set directly; use Trigger instead.
Implicitly sets DescriptionKey if null. Any of the below CardTriggerType can be used to proc the listed effects.
OnCast
OnKill
OnDiscard
OnMonsterDeath
OnAnyMonsterDeathOnFloor
OnAnyHeroDeathOnFloor
OnHealed
OnPlayerDamageTaken
OnAnyUnitDeathOnFloor
OnTreasure
OnUnplayed
OnFeed
Custom description for the trigger effect. Overrides DescriptionKey.
Use an existing base game trigger's description key to copy the format of its description.
Append to this list to add new card trigger effects. The Build() method recursively builds all nested builders.
Append to this list to add new card effects. The Build() method recursively builds all nested builders.
Builds the CardTriggerEffectData represented by this builder's parameters recursively; i.e. all CardEffectBuilders in cardEffects will also be built.

SingleRun, or SingleBattle

To add a status effect, no need for a builder. new StatusEffectStackData with properties statusId (string) and count (int) are sufficient. Get the string with -> statusEffectID = MTStatusEffectIDs.GetIDForType(statusEffectType);

Determines if we should use the total trigger count as the tracked value instead of using a value from CardStatistics. Use this to limit triggers to X per turn or per battle.

Provides easy access to all of the base game's card effect types

Card pool used for the Cov 1 random pool and end-of-battle card rewards, among other things
Use unknown
Provides easy access to all of the base game's card trait types
Provides easy access to all of the base game's clan IDs
Provides easy access to all of the base game's enhancer pool IDs
The first slot in the Spell Upgrade Shop, always contains a -1 Ember upgrade.
The second slot in the Spell Upgrade Shop. Contains Magic Power +10 and Consume, Magic Power +20.
The third slot in the Spell Upgrade Shop. Contains Holdover, remove Consume, Permafrost and Doublestack. Permafrost is Stygian themed but not limited.
The first two slots in the Unit Upgrade Shop. Contains +10 attack, +25 Health, and +10/+10. Also contains a class specific upgrade for your main and subclass.
The last slots in the Unit Upgrade Shop. Contains themed rare upgrades available for all classes. Multistrike (Hellhorned), Quick (Awoken), Largestone (Umbra) and Endless (Remnant). Stygian is in rare Spell upgrades.
Provides easy access to all of the base game's map node pool IDs
Holds all the clans' banners, but selects only the one corresponding to the current primary clan
Holds all the clans' banners, but selects only the one corresponding to the current allied clan
Provides easy access to all of the base game's relic pool IDs
Relic pool used for all random relic rewards
Daedalus boss relic reward
Fel boss relic reward
Provides easy access to all of the base game's status effect IDs

The second slot in the Spell Upgrade Shop. Contains Magic Power +10 and Consume, Magic Power +20.
The third slot in the Spell Upgrade Shop. Contains Holdover, remove Consume, Permafrost and Doublestack. Permafrost is Stygian themed but not limited.
The first two slots in the Unit Upgrade Shop. Contains +10 attack, +25 Health, and +10/+10. Also contains a class specific upgrade for your main and subclass.
The last slots in the Unit Upgrade Shop. Contains themed rare upgrades available for all classes. Multistrike (Hellhorned), Quick (Awoken), Largestone (Umbra) and Endless (Remnant). Stygian is in rare Spell upgrades.

Used to queue a Character Trigger to be automatically executed during key phases of combat. If you need to ensure that your trigger is executed at other times, please use QueueAndRunTrigger with a coroutine.
CharacterTrigger to be queued Character to Queue the Trigger On Whether the Character being triggered can Attack or be Healed Whether the trigger can currently be fired Additional Parameters for controlling how the trigger is fired Number of Times to Trigger Returns Whether it succeeded at Queuing a trigger internally
Used to queue a Character Trigger to be automatically executed during key phases of combat. If you need to ensure that your trigger is executed at other times, please use QueueAndRunTrigger with a coroutine.
CharacterTrigger to be queued Characters to Queue trigger on Whether the Character being triggered can Attack or be Healed Whether the trigger can currently be fired Additional Parameters for controlling how the trigger is fired Number of Times to Trigger

CardTrigger to be Applied Card to apply triggers to Whether Apply Card Triggers should fire on monster's Instead, requires Trigger to have an associated character trigger Room to fire triggers in, -1 defaults to selected room Whether effects applied by the trigger should ignore dead in targetting Character used to determine how many times Card Trigger should be applied Action to take after applying trigger
A function used to fire a card trigger, causing the effects of the corresponding trigger on the playedCard to be fired.

<<<<<<< HEAD <<<<<<< HEAD ======= >>>>>>> ec80dfd... Make many minor changes to existing API code
This patch fixes display on card upgrade trees
This patch adds in the custom icon for a clan. We could theoretically add these to VictoryUI's ClassIconMapping list, which seems better in theory. In practice, we have no way to guarantee the existence of VictoryUI in the scene at the time of Class instantiation, and no way to serialize the class mapping in advance of
